Description: Large black-topped brown ware bowl of Nile silt pottery with diagonal rippling on the exterior walls, burnished loosely in perpendicular direction. Interior is black; upper walls are rippled vertically and well burnished at interior rim, more loosely burnished below. Rim is milled. The flattened base is not rippled. One-third of the vessel is absent.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. 15.44E)
Condition: fair (incomplete -half missing, surface worn, some cracking)
